message: The religion thing.

When you interpret data coming in, or misinterpret data, isn't there a balancing act that goes on? You're taking random instances and instances that seemingly have more pattern to them and judging them in order to make your interpretation.

To help, my story (in vague terms) involves two guys who make an extraordinary discovery, and the Story Goal is Understanding--trying to understand what that thing is. They will have differing interpretations of the evidence, leading to conflict. But equity and inequity don't seem to fit. Fairness never enters into it.

I think it could be differing interpretations of fair and unfair as per Mike. As far equity/inequity, the idea would be that errors of interpretation occur because of the varying levels of weight given to incoming data. How is your quad setup (Prob. Solution etc.) and what throughline?
My wife and I interpret our marriage differently: I see "you cook, I eat" as equal shares. Somehow, she thinks that's an inequality.
I just started a discussion, and now here I am starting another one.  Can you tell I'm trying to hash out a new story?

I'm puzzled about "Interpretation", inside Activity/Understanding.  With most quads you can kind of see how the four items add up to the larger item.  But I'm confused how "Order/Chaos/Equity/Inequity" add up to "Interpretation".  I can kind of understand Order and Chaos, trying to pull scattered thoughts into an ordered understanding.  But how do equity and inequity fit in?
LOL
hah thats great!

I see how that's interpretation, but I'm still not clear how it's equity/inequity. How does a concept of fairness affect interpretation?  Is it, as Mike says, differing interpretations of what's fair and unfair?
Or that humans are descendants of aliens of something like that?
For instance, some proof positive that an underlying tenet of a major religion is false?

I haven't made any firm decisions.  I was considering having Interpretation as Overall Issue, but I couldn't figure out how to use equity/inequity or order/chaos as problem/solution.  They don't seem to fit yet.
Also consider that Equity & Inequity can also mean "balance" & "out of balance".  Is the discovery so extraordinary that it will change the balance of society?
Funny how that works.  :)
Let that Equity/Inequity thing roll around in your head for a awhile -- I think it really does fit.
Definitely something to mull.  I will go into mull mode.
Wow, good guess.  That's actually in the ballpark.
Then I think you're on to something, and I think Dramatica has caused you to think about a dimension of your story that you may not have considered or realized yet.
Mull away!
Thanks, guys!
@SandyStone I envy your experience with the theory. How nice it must be to know the synonyms for things right off the bat....
Yeesss, right off the bat... with no help whatsoever from that "Command-D" function...   :-}
